sen.j: 典鑰（てんやく）とは、律令制において中務省に属した品官（ほんかん）である。
sen.e: Tenyaku was Honkan, the collective name of government posts, belonged to Nakatsukasasho under the ritsuryo legal code system.
Tenyaku referred to Honkan, a government post, which belonged to Nakatsukasasho in the ritsuryo legal code system.
Tenyaku referred to Honkan, a government post, which belonged to Nakatsukasasho in the ritsuryo legal code system.
The Japanese reading of Tenyaku was 'Kaginotsukasa.'
The Japanese reading of Tenyaku was 'Kaginotsukasa.'
The Japanese reading of Tenyaku was 'Kaginotsukasa.'

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の持統天皇7年（693年）条に監物と共に初出しているため、飛鳥浄御原令期には存在したと考えられている。
sen.e: As Tenyaku first appeared with Kenmotsu in the Article of the seventh year of the reign of Emperor Jito, i.e., in 693, of "Nihonshoki", it is considered that Tenyaku existed in the era of Asukakiyomihara Code.

As Tenyaku first appeared with Kenmotsu in the Article of the seventh year of the reign of Emperor Jito, i.e., in 693, of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), it is considered that Tenyaku existed in the era of Asukakiyomihara Code.
sen.cmt: (Chronicles of Japan)を追記、yearを eraに変更
sen.e: As Tenyaku first appeared with Kenmotsu in the Article of the seventh year of the reign of Emperor Jito, i.e., in 693, of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), it is considered that Tenyaku existed in the era of Asukakiyomihara Code.

sen.j: 監物とともに中務省の倉庫の主鑰を管理していた。
sen.e: Together with Kenmotsu, Tenyaku managed Shuyaku working at the warehouse of Nakatsukasasho.
Together with Kenmotsu, Tenyaku managed Shuyaku working at the warehouse of Nakatsukasasho.
Together with Kenmotsu, Tenyaku managed Shuyaku working at the warehouse of Nakatsukasasho.

sen.j: 典鑰は毎朝参内して後宮十二司の闡司より鑰を受け取ってこれを保管し、必要に応じて監物に鑰を渡したり返納を受けたりして夕方にはまた闡司に返却した。
sen.e: Tenyaku went to the Imperial Court every morning to receive a key from Mikadonotsukasa of Kokyujunishi, kept the key, handed the key to Kenmotsu if required or received the key returned from Kenmotsu, and returned the key to Mikadonotsukasa in the evening.

Tenyaku went to the Imperial Court every morning to receive a key from Mikadonotsukasa of Kokyujunishi, kept the key, handed the key to Kenmotsu if required or received the key returned from Kenmotsu, and returned the key to Mikadonotsukasa in the evening.

Tenyaku went to the Imperial Court every morning to receive a key from Mikadonotsukasa of Kokyujunishi, kept the key, handed the key to Kenmotsu if required or received the key returned from Kenmotsu, and returned the key to Mikadonotsukasa in the evening.

sen.j: なお、典鑰は鑰の管理のみを担当し、典鑰から鑰を受け取った監物が鑰の開け閉めと出納の管理を行い、主鑰（大主鑰・少主鑰）が実際の出納を行うという役割分担が厳格にされていたとされている。
sen.e: It is considered that the roles were strictly divided such that Tenyaku were only in charge of managing the key, Kenmotsu were in charge of receiving the key from Tenyaku, locking and unlocking of the key, and managing the delivery of the things to and from the warehouse, and Shuyaku (Daishuyaku, Shoshuyaku) were in charge of actual delivery of the things to and from the warehouse.

It is considered that the roles were strictly divided such that Tenyaku were only in charge of managing the key, Kenmotsu were in charge of receiving the key from Tenyaku, locking and unlocking with the key, and managing the delivery of the things to and from the warehouse, and Shuyaku (Daishuyaku, Shoshuyaku) were in charge of actual delivery of the things to and from the warehouse.
sen.cmt: locking and unlocking of the key --> locking and unlocking with the key
sen.e: It is considered that the roles were strictly divided such that Tenyaku were only in charge of managing the key, Kenmotsu were in charge of receiving the key from Tenyaku, locking and unlocking with the key, and managing the delivery of the things to and from the warehouse, and Shuyaku (Daishuyaku, Shoshuyaku) were in charge of actual delivery of the things to and from the warehouse.
Daitenyaku (Junior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade): 2
